title: LIGHT WEIGHT MOLDED ROOF TILE WITH INTEGRATED SOLAR CAPABILITIES
abstract: An improved building roof tile for a sloping roof including a polyurethane foam tile that includes outer coating layers that are made of a uniquely fire resistant or retardant layered system that includes a first outer fire resistant layer of 100% solid aliphatic polyurea material and a second inner layer of an 100% solid intumescent non-halogenated phosphate material, said inner layer forming a fire blocking partition and said outer layer offering UV protection, featherweight, category 5 hurricane proof, yields a high R-value, offer low thermal transference into attic space, will retrofit any sloped roof without structural build-up, can be molded into single or triple units, cannot break under foot or when extreme pressures are applied, can produce upgradable solar energy, is easy to transport and install and can molded to look like slate, wood, flat roll tile or most other historical tiles.

motivations: Traditional roof tiles lack integrated solar capabilities and may not provide adequate insulation or weather resistance.
There is a need for a lightweight, fire-resistant, and durable roof tile that can be easily installed and retrofitted on sloping roofs.
objectives: Design and develop a lightweight, molded roof tile with integrated solar capabilities and improved insulation properties.
Create a fire-resistant and durable roof tile that can withstand extreme weather conditions and provide UV protection.
methods: Utilize a polyurethane foam tile with a uniquely fire-resistant layered system, including a solid aliphatic polyurea material and an intumescent non-halogenated phosphate material.
Develop a molding process to create single or triple units that can be designed to resemble various historical tiles.
results: Provide a high R-value, low thermal transference, and category 5 hurricane-proof roof tile that can be easily installed and retrofitted on sloping roofs.
Offer a durable and fire-resistant roof tile that can produce upgradable solar energy and reduce energy consumption.
llama_json.research_subject: Development of a lightweight, molded roof tile with integrated solar capabilities and improved insulation properties

motivations: Traditional roof tiles are heavy, prone to breakage, and lack energy efficiency and fire resistance.
There is a need for lightweight, durable, and fire-resistant roof tiles that can also produce solar energy.
objectives: Develop a lightweight, fire-resistant roof tile with integrated solar capabilities.
Ensure the tile is easy to transport and install, and can be molded to resemble various traditional tile styles.
methods: Use polyurethane foam for the tile base, with outer coating layers made of fire-resistant materials.
Incorporate a layered system with an outer layer for UV protection and an inner layer as a fire-blocking partition.
Design the tile to be featherweight, hurricane-proof, and capable of low thermal transference into attic space.
results: Produce a roof tile that is lightweight, durable, fire-resistant, and capable of generating solar energy.
Create a tile that can retrofit any sloped roof without structural build-up and can be molded to resemble various traditional tile styles.
openai_json.research_subject: Development of a lightweight, fire-resistant roof tile with integrated solar capabilities

motivations: Traditional roof tiles are heavy, fragile, and lack integrated energy generation capabilities, requiring structural reinforcement and offering limited functionality.
Existing roofing materials often fail to provide adequate fire resistance, thermal insulation, and weather protection while maintaining lightweight properties.
objectives: Develop a lightweight, durable roof tile system that integrates solar energy capabilities while providing superior fire resistance and weather protection.
Create a versatile roofing solution that can retrofit existing structures without requiring structural modifications and mimic various traditional tile aesthetics.
methods: Utilize polyurethane foam core construction with a dual-layer protective coating system consisting of aliphatic polyurea and intumescent phosphate materials.
Integrate solar energy generation capabilities directly into the tile design while maintaining moldability for various aesthetic configurations.
results: Achieved a lightweight roofing system that provides high R-value insulation, category 5 hurricane resistance, and integrated solar energy production.
Developed tiles that are unbreakable under foot traffic, offer UV protection and fire resistance, and can be easily installed without structural modifications.
anthropic_json.research_subject: Lightweight polyurethane foam roof tiles with integrated solar capabilities and advanced protective coatings
